element.name: TBasicPointSeries.UseReticule
element.short: Show reticule for points of this series

element.name: TColorEachMode
element.short: Enumeration of possibilities how individual data point colors should be applied to a TLineSeries

descr.p: The TChartDataItem records from which a series receives its data values has a field Color as individual data point color.
Depending on the values of TColorEachMode these colors can be applied to a TLineSeries in these ways:

ul.li: ceNone: no individual colors
cePoint: color is applied to the pointer symbol.
ceLineBefore: color is applied to the segment before the data point
ceLineAfter: color is applied to the segment after the data point
cePointAndLineBefore: color is applied to the pointer symbol and the segment before it
cePointAndLineAfter: color is applied to the pointer symbol and the segment after it.

element.name: TLineSeries.ColorEach
element.short: Determines how an individual data point color is applied to the line series.

descr.p: The TChartDataItem records from which a series receives its data values has a field Color as individual data point color.
Depending on the values of TColorEachMode these colors can be applied to a TLineSeries in these ways:

ul.li: ceNone: no individual colors
cePoint: color is applied to the pointer symbol.
ceLineBefore: color is applied to the segment before the data point
ceLineAfter: color is applied to the segment after the data point
cePointAndLineBefore: color is applied to the pointer symbol and the segment before it
cePointAndLineAfter: color is applied to the pointer symbol and the segment after it.

element.name: TLineSeries.LinePen
element.short: Defines the pen used to draw the line segments between the data points

element.name: TLineSeries.SeriesColor
element.descr: This is the same as the color of the TLineSeries.LinePen .

element.name: TLineSeries.ShowLines
element.short: Allows to quickly turn on/off the connecting lines between the data points
element.descr: The same effect can be achieved by changing TLineSeries.LineType to ltNone.

element.name: TLineSeries.ShowPoints
element.short: Allows to quickly turn on/off the data point symbols

descr.p: The appearance of the data point symbols is determined by property Pointer .
Changing Pointer.Visible has the same effect as changing ShowLines.

element.name: TLineType
element.short: Enumeration of possibilities how the data points are connected in a TLineSeries

ul.li: ltNone: no connecting line (like TLineSeries.ShowLines =false)
ltFromPrevious: draws a connection to the previous data point; the standard behavior
ltFromOrigin: draws a line from the data point to the origin
ltStepXY: draws first a line in x and then in y direction to achieve a "stepped" look
ltStepYX: draws first a line in y and then in x direction to achieve a "stepped look

element.name: TLineSeries.LineType
element.short: Determines how data points are connected by lines

ul.li: ltNone: no connecting lines (like ShowLines =false)
ltFromPrevious: draws a connection to the previous data point; the standard behavior
ltFromOrigin: draws a line from the data point to the origin
ltStepXY: draws first a line in x and then in y direction to achieve a "stepped" look
ltStepYX: draws first a line in y and then in x direction to achieve a "stepped" look
